intro: Prosanerpis panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
